TopicTitle: Unity Models (Vessels) in VAB/SPH to WebGL/Three.js

Articles.Content:
This was a difficult google search.

Is there a way to use C# to export a Unity Model 'in real time' to a WebGL/Three.js friendly file?

This would be a great feature I'm thinking to the KVV if people could export a Kerbal-Web-Friendly-Standard file. This would be neat if you we could have gallery pages with spinning samples of our creations .

Edited September 18, 2014 by bigorangemachine

I'm not sure about the specific implementation you're attempting, but have you tried Sketchfab*?

*Upload your model to Sketchfab and use the KSP forum's embed tool to directly insert the Sketchfab preview into your posts.

EDIT: Just noticed that the context of the problem was the Kronal Vessel Viewer.

EDIT: Just noticed that the context of the problem was the Kronal Vessel Viewer.

Not really. I mean if we could get the Representation of what the Kronal is rendering out into webGL/3.js that would be ideal.

I just thought it would be cool if we could get Vessels into a web friendly format.

I mean if we could get the Representation of what the Kronal is rendering out into webGL/3.js that would be ideal.

I just thought it would be cool if we could get Vessels into a web friendly format.

Sketchfab does use some form of WebGL, according to Wikipedia:

The Sketchfab 3D viewer is using the WebGL JavaScript API to display 3D models and is built using the open-source OSG.JS JavaScript library. This allows the display of 3D models on webpages without the need of third-party plugins if the browser supports WebGL. On browsers that don't support the WebGL technology, the Sketchfab viewer uses a 2D fallback displaying a pre-rendered 3D model.

It's up to you to study the Sketchfab API to see if you can hook Kronal up to it.

I see what you are saying!

I also found that you can use UnityEditor API to export stuff at runtime. If I can export then send to Sketchfab... people could do what I would like
This sounds really awesome! Keep it up.
